Reviews.Title: “Calm Competent Convenient Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: This property is perched on the Inner Harbor between the Fells Point area and downtown. It's a pleasant 15 minute walk across harbor footbridges to the Convention Center and no more than a ten minute walk to Broadway in Fells Point with its clubs, restaurants and cafes. It's a relatively new residential neighborhood and there's a Whole Foods around the corner and a trendy coffee shop across the street and just about anything else you could want for an extended stay. The hotel boasts large rooms, opening windows, nice views and a quiet street for pleasant sleeping. The staff is exceptionally friendly, the restaurant serves a fine breakfast (buffet if you want), and the cozy bar area includes a smiling, competent bartender. I could not find anything wrong with this place and would choose it anytime over more expensive hotels in the area,

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a great location”
Reviews.Author: NjTravelBugg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights over spring break with my husband and 2 daughters and thought it was a great choice at $209/night. Nice, clean, comfortable lobby, easy check-in. We opted to park a block away in a secured, multi-level parking garage for $13/night vs the hotel's $23/night - highly recommend for those staying for a few days and not planning to use their car. The hotel was a 10-minute walk to the Inner Harbor, although we didn't realize that on our first day and took the free Charm City Circulator bus (we were the only tourists...mostly locals seemed to be using it and the route took a good 20+ minutes or more to get to the Inner Harbor area). We were just a few blocks from Little Italy where we enjoyed dinner one night at Amicci's followed by pastries and gelato across the street at Vaccaro's. We were also a 5-minute walk to the hub of the Fell's Point neighborhood - lots of pubs and shops made for a nice afternoon stroll. The pool was open from 5-10 daily and was small but just right for the toddler/elementary school crowd, ranging from 3 feet to 4 1/2 feet deep. The hot tub wasn't hot, more like warm bath water with bubbles, so for good or for bad, kids were allowed in. Complimentary coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lobby every morning, and free cookies in the lobby if you hit it at the right time :) There was a good pizza/deli next door to the hotel (buyer beware...pizza was very good but $20 for a pie!)...Bagby's a block over was also recommended for good pizza. Around the corner was a Whole Foods so we picked up dinner one night and brought it back to our rooms to eat. Dinner at Shuckers in Fell's Point was just okay, but super-fresh sushi at the Kona Grill was delicious. The CVS around the corner came in very handy when we realized we forgot to pack toothpaste and one of our toothbrushes. If we were to return to Baltimore, I wouldn't hesitate to book our stay at this hotel again! One last note...one of the highlights of our trip was the dolphin show at the aquarium (buy your tickets and book your show time in advance!!!) and the American Visionary Art Museum for sculptures made from bottlecaps and statues of toothpicks (visual fun!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lag1009
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not a full service hotel. They do serve a buffet breakfast but do not have dinner service- only room service. Hotel was clean, housekeeping efficient, bar/lounge comfortable. Pool on the 4 floor clean and warm. Outside of the pool area there is an outdoor lounge/courtyard (we had our Easter egg hunt). Hotel is within walking distance to the harbor which we did 3x's a day. There are boutiques on Aliceanna - expensive but nice to walk around! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful on all levels! The courtyard is 3 blocks from Little Italy (not what little Italy in NYC is) there is one nice restaurant Della Note.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zazuHicksville
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from April 5th to 8th. Check in very easy, Tony at front desk very nice and everyone very helpful. I parked in a garage a couple of blocks away- it was half the price. Since we have been in the area before- this was for my daughters volleyball tournament - we new to park elsewhere to save a little. The rooms were very clean- the pillows and bed so comfortable. I didn't request a fridge but other people had. It is a good few blocks walk to Harbour but a nice location. There is a 24 hour CVS, a WholeFoods right around the block. The mexican place- forgot name- around block was great! James Joyce Pub down the block- ate there twice- loved the food and prices excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: raincheck10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my family and found this hotel to be a typical Courtyard in a very nice location. Checkin was fast, self parking easy ($23/n), room was clean. We spent a lot of time at the convention center and it was a sceanic 15 minute walk to get there or you could take a cab for around $7. Also it was very easy to walk to Fells Point for meals that didnt feel as touristy as the Inner Harbour. Whole Foods, CVS and a movie theater are within 1 block of the Marriott. Also had diner at the Mexican place attached to the hotel, really good food at decent prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: ZA2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right by very nice restaurants and the inner harbor. I have stayed over 100 nights in the past 4 years and have never had such noise issues. The guest decided to talk on her cell phone from 11-1am which was perfect for my early morning flight. Really not the hotel's issue aside from having pretty thin walls and also putting her right next to me when there were plenty of other rooms available. My wake up call was also 10 minutes late and the bathrooms need to be updated. I'd definitely stay here again but I would probably be more quick to call downstairs and have the quest next to me quiet down.

Reviews.Title: “Johns Hopkins Visit”
Reviews.Author: Will B
Reviews.Content: Our daughter required a complicated surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital which required a stay close to the hospital and convenient to restaurants, etc. Upon some research we selected this Courtyard. It was a perfect location. The night prior to the surgery, we ate at a great restaurant within walking distance, the Waterfront Kitchen. The next two days were to and from the hotel to the hospital. The staff, headed by Jessica at the front desk, was great and they provided taxi vouchers for both directions which saved time and money. If you need a place under similar circumstances, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Altaskibum
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Courtyard at least twenty times. One of the reasons I keep coming back is that its location is great. Whole Foods is around the corner and there are a number of great restaurants in walking distance. The staff at this hotel are always nice and accomodating. It also has easy parking for a downtown hotel, but at $23 a night it is a bit on the high side. Similar to the other reviewers I found the rooms to be a bit small and the towels are probably the among the worst I have experienced in my 700+ nights at Marriotts. They try to offset the horrible towels by giving you three, but that does not make up for the most flimsy and worn towels you will see anywhere. Probably the biggest current issue with this hotel is the never ending road construction ouside the hotel. It has been going on since late last year and if you have a room facing the street you might get woken up with construction work starting early in the morning. The hotel has no control over this issue, but you should be aware. The only way to avoid this issue is to book a room that does not face the road. The only trouble with this solution is that there are no king size beds on the inner side. Not sure why the hotel only has doubles on that side! Because of the road construction I have gone to another Marriott in Baltimore, however, once the construction is over I will give it another shot...mainly because of the location!

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason for the 3 Bath Towels”
Reviews.Author: Old_Pogue_Bourbon
Reviews.Content: Generally a nice hotel located in the trendy Inner Harbor East area. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. A Whole Foods Market and CVS Pharmacy within 2 minutes of the Hotel door. The service was OK...not extraordinary. Rooms are a little smail and the Vanity - Shower/Toilet area is poorly situated. If you need to sit anything larger than a stick of deoderant on the vanity you're screwed. - Then there are the bath towels - think Bounty. If you want to sleep past 6:30 I'm sorry...this is not the place for you. I was on the 7th floor, am slightly hard of hearing and sleep very soundly. The city wakes up at 6:30 and you are waking up with it...whether you like it or not. This hotel has too many shortcomings to rate a good value at $160 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Grinchie
Reviews.Content: Our family booked this hotel as part of our son's fourth birthday gift - a trip to the aquarium and a stay in a hotel with an indoor pool. Our requirements were: walking distance to the aquarium, indoor pool and reasonable price. This location more than met those requirements. We brought along another family and we asked for adjoining rooms when checking in. Even though we had reserved different room configurations, they were able to accommodate our request. Our room was very nice, with a king bed and pull-out couch for our son. The only strange thing was that the pack of linens only contained a single flat sheet, a thin blanket and a pillow. So I did have to request another sheet so that he's have something between his body and the blanket. In addition, our room faced Aliceanna Street, where there was street construction. So every time a car went over the steel plates on the road, there was a loud noise. The kids were so tired from the pool they barely noticed, but it woke us up a few times. Totally not the hotel's fault, of course. The pool area was great for the kids and it's nice to see a hotel pool with a lifeguard. He did a great job keeping the other group of preteen boys under control and keeping the noise down. The other patrons and the staff were all so friendly. The other great thing was being able to park in the attached garage. And they might not tell you, but you can continue to stay in the garage for a few hours after you check out - great for us as we checked out and went to the aquarium. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but just ordinary Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad4040
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed here and both times it came down to location and price. Overall the hotel is just another Courtyard in need of an update. The rooms are clean and the staff is great but it has not been updated as many are. With that being said I would stay here in a heartbeat again because the location is awesome. There is a Marriott next door that I would prefer to stay at but they are very proud of their price. Bottom line...good hotel for the location just don't expect the latest and greatest Courtyard experience. One other thing regarding Courtyards overall...when are they going to join other hotel chains and reward Platinum members with. Free breakfast????

Reviews.Title: “Night out on the town”
Reviews.Author: kueric09
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the gf here after a night out checking out Baltimore and its nightlife. The location is great. The rooms were very spacious for a downtown location (I know its not Manhattan but full-sized rooms). Very clean (I'd venture to guess it's a new Courtyard). Self-Parking is a LOT expensive, but at least it connects to the hotel itself.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service- Always clean room”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel, it had friendly staff, a fun location, lots of neat little shops and restaurants nearby, and it was pretty easy access from the I-95 without being next to the freeway. The parking killed me though.- They did not tell me that they would bill me $24 a day for parking. OUCH!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst towles EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristy M
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for only one night... thankfully! (Jan. 17-18, 2012) First, the hotel pool is only open from 5PM-10PM on weekdays. Big downer for the kids! The room ammenities stated there were refrigerators & microwaves in the rooms....not our room! The bath towles were like sandpaper...no joke...you have to blot, not wipe! They were terriable, the worst I've ever experienced in a hotel and, lastly the hotel was very noisey at night, you could hear everyone around you in other rooms. I was awoken several times by other guests. We will not be returning to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: MDBeachLoverAlso
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Friday night in January. Gave us a traditional room that had a balcony with nice city view- that was an unexpected pleasant surprise. Front desk was very pleasant. Bartender was happy to serve us drinks at 10:55 even though she was closing up at 11pm. Hotel was not crowded and they had no problem giving us a late check out. Breakfast buffet for 10.95 was reasonable for the food choices (including made to order eggs and waffles) and the service was great there too. Walking distance to restaurants and a nice spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value + Great Location + Extra-Helpful Staff = Vacation Gold!”
Reviews.Author: Leon1977
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here December 30th and 31st of 2011. Here are a few reasons why I give this property an excellent review: 1. The price for our Suite was much more affordable than the waterfront hotels' suites, and parking was significantly lower at $23/day (vs $40). The neighborhood was safe and had excellent italian restaurants and was an easy walk to the inner harbor. Communication with hotel staff prior to arrival was excellent. We were happy to get both early check-in and late check-out. 2. The breakfast buffet had an incredible selection and was a great value. The staff even went so far as to bring my coffee to my room as my hands were already full and provide us with a corkscrew as I left mine at home. Plus, they had a complementary sparkling cider toast on NYE, and fresh cookies in the afternoon! 3. The bartender knew the exact price of the drink I requested and I was happy that my drink was not over-priced as so many other hotel lobby bars can be. 4. The Hotel Manager exceeded my expectations as we could not find a restaurant that would accommodate our large party for dinner. He offered the use of a private dining area for us to enjoy our dinner. I would like to personally thank the Hotel Staff for making our stay enjoyable and memorable! I would recommend staying here to anyone looking for an afforable, convenient, and pleasant trip to the Baltimore Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Isaiah S
Reviews.Content: The view of the harbor from my room was fantastic and the location of the hotel was perfect! I stayed here when I was in town to check out the aquarium. Definitely worth your while to stay here. The hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PattyK7189
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Baltimore Downtown/Inner Harbor was a comfortable stay. The cost was less than some of the other hotels in the area, and there is a parking garage for the car. You can purchase parking (which is expensive at $23 a night- but comparable to other hotels.) The room was clean, but the bathroom doorknob was broken, and the toilet clogged right after we got there. The bedding was clean, and it looked as if there were more sheets and a small duvet instead of a top spread, which suggested to me that the sheets were all cleaned with each guest. They offered their "green" option of not getting the sheets changed each night for your entire stay, and they would only wash towels that you left on the floor to save resources. The workout room was small, but functional. We did not use the pool or the business rooms, but they looked well maintained. Overall, the price matched the quality of the hotel, and it was within walking distance to area attractions. I would recommend it for this reason:)

Reviews.Title: “not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: love m
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are over priced and need updating...

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: Paul_D_Tyler
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent guest at the hotel. Dollar-for-dollar, it's a great value. Other more expensive hotels do have nicer rooms and facilities. However, rooms are always clean. The location is incredibly convenient for walks around the harbor or into Fells Point. The exercise facilities are spartan at best, but the hotel provides free passes to one of the best gyms I have used just a block away. The wifi is not great, but management promises an upgrade in the next couple of months. Breakfast is a great deal. Most importantly, the staff is incredibly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff / problems with rooms”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: We had a block of rooms reserved for out of town guests to attend a wedding. Unfortunately it was not a pleasant experience for any of us. Starting with the front desk staff - they were extremely RUDE (one woman in particular). Then each room had some sort of problem; sinks that would not drain, door keys that were unpredictable - working one time then not the next, broken a/c units. I would give this hotel a MINUS 5 if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: TDDToronto
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Inner Harbour for 20 days. Location is in the upscale neighbourhood of Harbour East. The hotel is surrounded by offices, condos, many restaurants and shops. It is a short walk along the harbour back to the touristy inner harbour with its museum ships, aquarium, more restaurants and the most elegant Barnes & Noble I have ever seen. A short walk the other way leads to Fells Point, an area of coble stone roads, many bars and shops. The suites are all located on the corner of the hotel with south and west views, opening windows, separate living room and bedroom with a very comfortable king bed, a small kitchenette with mini fridge and microwave. Free WiFi, 2 televisions. A Whole Foods is located in the same building - accessible through the hotel parking lot if weather is bad. Across the street is a 24 hour CVS which also sells some food and drink. On the same block is a pizza/sandwhich shop, a Mexican restaurant, a wine shop and a candy store. There is a guest laundry, washer and dryer $1.00 each and includes soap. The pool is small and open very limited hours. A large roof deck is always open. Our rate included the buffet breakfast (usulally $12.00) which served eggs, any style, omlettes, the usual buffet items - bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, waffles, fruit, cerials, breads, pastries. Rooms were serviced regularly every day with basic materials. If you want high end soaps and thicker soft towels, try to much more expensive Marriott Harbour just down the street or the adjacent Four Seasons. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel - good location, good rooms and relatively inexpensive. Do watch out for the $21.00 parking fee and steer clear of Maggie Moos Ice Cream Parlour in Fells Point - over $5.00 for a small cone.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip with 7 yr old”
Reviews.Author: chanoine78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Baltimore Inner Harbor on 10/22/11 to 10/23/2011. The normal rate on their website, as well, as Expedia and Hotels.com was $159/night plus tax which came to $188. I "Named your own price" on Priceline and got the room for only $70/night plus tax, came to $88. GREAT DEAL! Saved over 50%. The staff was very friendly and had a room ready for me when I checked in at 11 am on Saturday. I was very pleased with this, because I was well aware check in was not until 3 pm, and was hoping I would be able to settle in before hitting the museums and such. This was an excellent location. Close to shopping, restaurants, and Inner Harbor Attractions. It is true parking is $23 per night, but your car can stay in parking garage until 4 pm on the day of checkout. This was nice because there were still a few more activities we wanted to do before we left on Sunday (i.e. the Aquarium, Reginald F Lewis African American Musuem, and Port Discovery Children's Museum). You can take a water taxi ($10 adult $5 child all day pass, or included if you by Harbor pass for $60 adult and $45 child) to inner harbor attractions or 10-15 min walk. Hotel room was what you would expect from 3 star Courtyard, bathrooms and linens were clean. I do wish they would put a comforter on the bed. When did they stop doing that? Also, a fridge would be nice. I was told you could request one, but didn't get around to it. They serve breakfast downstairs from 7 am -11 am ($10.95pp), I didn't try it, but took a look at the options. Everything looked freshly made, eggs, hash browns, bacon, sausage, pastries and bagels, also waffle machine to make fresh waffles yourself. They have room service from restaurant next door til midnight. My daughter and I also tried out the pool and Jacuzzi on Saturday night after a long day of sightseeing. They had a lifeguard on duty until it closed at 10 pm, which I thought was nice. The last Courtyard at stayed at in Philly last month did not have a lifeguard. My daughter enjoyed the heated pool, it was about 4 1/2' deep. I myself did not get in, but watched her swim from the jacuzzi. The jacuzzi was perfect. It could probably accomodate 10 people comfortably but we had the whole place to ourselves. Overall, I would definitely stayed there again. And I recommend this place for anyone staying in the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location good value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: simpangratis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, free wifi, lots of eateries nearby. Would definitely consider staying there again on business or with family.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly thumbs-up”
Reviews.Author: liwoodco
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice for a conference, and had a generally positive experience. The staff are excellent - right down to the catering team - they all take pride in a job well done. The location is outstanding and convenient to the major attractions, too. My only issue is with the locks on the hotel doors - they jam regularly (had it happen on both trips), and according to the front desk it's a known issue.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible waste of money...”
Reviews.Author: maplesugarsnow
Reviews.Content: Terribly overpriced. I have stayed in top Marriot resorts for less per night. This room wasn't even a nice Courtyard. The bathroom only had a shower, no tub. Parking is 23 per night. The fitness center smelled.like must.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: gld8317
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Courtyard Inner Harbor, enjoying the harbor activities. The hotel location was great, central to Inner Harbor to the west, Fells point to the east, and Little Italy to the North. Didn't need the car for 3 days because everything was easily within walking distance. The hotel was very clean, and well kept. The staff was excellent. Secure parking was right next door, very convenient. Very good weekend at the Harbor. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler14
Reviews.Content: First time at this property, but definitely not the last. Great location by the waterfront, with walking access to restaurants, events, and sites. The staff was very knowledgeable with the area amenities, and were most helpful with any request. There is parking, but a cab is the best way in and out of the area. Rooms are typical Courtyard, but modernized and extremely well maintained. For a downtown hotel, the noise level was not intrusive and did not interfere with sleeping. Good bar area, active lobby, and there are some really good restaurants within a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: We ended up here when the original hotel we booked, The Brexton, messed up our reservation and we were forced to find alternate accommodations at the last minute. There was space at this hotel for a reasonable price and are we ever glad the Brexton messed up because otherwise we would never have stayed here. This is a nice size hotel right at the Inner Harbor area of Baltimore. It has a lovely lobby, a parking lot attached (pay parking) and the rooms are clean and comfortable, if not luxurious. But this is a Courtyard and it's actually better than I expected. And the staff are very helpful with directions and recommendations - always with a smile. Oh, and the free WiFi was a nice touch. Walk outside the hotel and you are a block away from beautiful high end stores and lovely restaurants of the Inner Harbor area as well as the usual standbys like Filene's Basement, etc. A block or two away is Little Italy filled with what I hear are great restaurants but we didn't get to try any because Hurricane Irene rushed us out of Baltimore earlier than we had planned. But if we return to the city, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really average for Courtyards... not a place I will seek out in the future”
Reviews.Author: 4RealBeach
Reviews.Content: As you'll read on here, the location is pretty great. And it is. That's about it. Rates were good and the reviews positive, so I thought I would give it a try. The rooms are as typical of a courtyard 3 years ago as you will find. Nothing really updated except the TV. Everything just felt cheap. I've stayed in a lot of the remodeled courtyards and many newer ones... they all have a feel that is a notch above what this was. Bathroom was mostly clean - shower felt a little dated and dingy. Bed was typical - and if you don't know what that means, it means no comforter. The lobby is nice enough with a restaurant and a new lounge area. Overall, given the price I may stay here again, but I had expected more based on the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad4040
Reviews.Content: The location is what gets the 4 stars. Very walkable to Fells Point and the Inner Harbor. The hotel itself is maybe a notch above ok. Lobby was alright but rooms still had that very basic Courtyard feel. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel. Convenient access to Johns Hopkins”
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while I was visiting Johns Hopkins Medical Center. The hotel offers a special rate for people conducting business with Hopkins and also offer taxi vouchers. In addition, they throw in breakfast as well. So, all in all, very convenient if you are going to Hopkins. The location is great, near lots of restaurants and downtown. The hotel, itself, is clean and comfortable. Nothing fancy, but certainly well within expectations. One added plus is that although they have their own fitness center and pool, they also offer free access to the MAC, an excellently equipped gym.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a night, for a meeting in Marriot Inner Harbour a block away. The room is perfectly adequate. Clean, spacious, comfortable bed, good working table, good chair, good airconditioning that works well. Nothing very exciting, but for business stay, thats all one needs. Worth mentioning that the wifi connection is great. My laptop hasnt got the most reliable receiver and often have to rely on a wired connection via a ethernet cable to work when in a hotel room. But in this hotel, it worked straightaway, consistently, and fast. The room does not have an in-room safe or a fridge. I didnt try its breakfast so I am afraid I can comment on this. Reception is friendly enough. There is a small selection of cold drinks in a fridge next to the reception for sale. In terms of area, its a block away from the Marriott Inner Harbour, a block or two away from Little Italy. However, it is not close to the convention centre which I suppose is about 15 minutes walk away. In term of price, I paid almost $300 (plus tax) for the room. I find this expensive for what I get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kris578
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for four nights over one of the hottest summer heat waves I've ever experienced (106 on the water!). The A/C was kept pumping throughout our stay in every crevice of the hotel and was very appreciated. The Yard pub is perfect for a drink before or after dinner and the breakfast buffet was my husband's favorite every morning. Easy walking commute down to the convention center even in the heat, as you can just walk across the street and go up through sky walk. We'll stay again when we're in town next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: chester1
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel with no added benefits for Gold members of Marriott, but the location is superb and the cost is reasonable. The pool is also quite nice. It was a short walk to the inner harbor or to Fells Point to take in the historic location, pubs, etc. Also, there is a free City Charmer Sightseeing bus that picks up practically right outside the door. Finally, there is a Whole Foods AND a CVS right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: nanniex2
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Courtyard and was very pleased with the room, staff and food. There are very high buildings around the hotel, so it's hard to get a room with an excellent view, but there are a few. The main thing, it was clean and anything you requested such as more towels, pillows, shampoo or coffee, they brought it up immediately. There is a buffet breakfast served each morning and it's very good. Well worth the cost. There's a sports bar one block away, pizza next door (so good) CVS 24hrs) around the corner, Whole Foods store on the corner for extra food pick ups items and the Inner Harbor is only two blocks away with interesting sites all along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: Betty4764
Reviews.Content: Location made it possible to walk or take the water taxi to many Inner Harbor sites. Close and yet far enough away from the really crowded area. Comfortable bed and quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: 19mandy84
Reviews.Content: I went to Baltimore on a 3 day business trip back in June 2011. When I arrived at 9:30pm, I was warmly greeted. I went to my room and it was very clean. It had a nice tv, comfortable bed and the usual toiletries you would expect at a hotel. It also had an iron/board and a blow dryer. My favorite part was that I got free wireless Internet. I've been to places where I paid more for my room and had to pay $12/day for Internet. The pool & hottub was not the best set up (inside), it was very hot in the pool room. I only stayed for a short period of time cause I couldn't handle the heat any longer. Outside the pool room was an outdoor patio, very nice. It was nice and close to the galleria for shopping and the harbor for wonderful food and scenery. Great location, nice staff, clean and right next to a cvs and whole foods. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple stays - all great!”
Reviews.Author: travellocally
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Courtyard on a fairly regular basis for business, and I've never been disappointed. The staff is great, and the location is wonderful for the price. It's an easy walk to the harbor, where one could visit the National Aquarium, ride the water taxis, shop, or eat. I had been there several times before I knew about "The Gallery." Enter the Pratt Street Pavilion, go upstairs to the doors near Five Guys and Fries. Walk across the street into that building and follow the long hallway to a four-story mall. And back to the Courtyard....rooms have always been nice (usually stay on 6th or 7th floor). They are wonderful about calling taxis for early morning trips to the airport. There ARE generally taxis as well across the street during "regular" hours, and the SuperShuttle stops at this hotel. I'll definitely be back and would stay here on personal trips as well! Oh....and you can make it to Camden Yards if you're interested in a bit of a walk. I think we made it in 20-25 minutes and felt extremely safe walking back after the game.

Reviews.Title: “Great business stay”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business. Very clean room, spacious, comfortable bed. I think I was given a handicap room because there was only a shower, but that was fine with me. Convenient location, restaurants within a block and Whole Foods supermarket around corner. Rate much less than sister Marriott properties a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl99
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed in other Courtyard hotels, then you'll know exactly what to expect... a solid standard business hotel. Clean rooms, standard amenities. It's in a nice location near the Inner Harbor. My favorite part about the location is that it shares a parking deck with Whole Foods. You don't even need to walk outside to get to it! When visiting the area, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location In A Safe Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jmartibOswego_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and found this hotel above average due in a large part because of its location. The room #1119 was smallish but satisfactory except for the walk in shower enclosure doors which were difficult to move. I will never understand a $150 a night room with $2 doors. Having said this, most else was above average. The check-in staff is far above average and handled all very well. The attached parking garage was very clean and well lit. No safety issues here. Parking with in and out privileges is $23 per day. The pool & spa area was also very very clean. The spa temperature was 100 degrees plus and unfortunately the pool water temperature may have been 70 degrees. The immediate neighborhood is filled with many many restaurants of all kinds. Look closely however, the prices can be a little above average. Around the corner from this hotel is a CVS pharmacy and a Whole Foods market. This is a wonderful place if you are looking for natural products, fresh meats and groceries in general. Also there is fresh ( good ) coffee served in the morning along with a sitdown area for breakfast. I would recommend going here for a look. Within a 5 minute walk over to the Marriott hotel you can find the Water Taxi stand. Pay $10 per person for an all day pass to ride around the harbor as well as other destinations such as Fort McHenry. To see this water taxi, do a google search for Baltimore Harbor Water Taxi. If you choose to walk to the hot spots at the Inner Harbor, plan on a 15 minute walk. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet, Clean”
Reviews.Author: TheCFO
Reviews.Content: Wanted a place near, but not at, the event I was attending. This was great, good wireless connection, quiet room close to the bustle of the Inner Harbor. Greatl little pizza/cafe adjacent with outdoor dining.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. Both times we came for a Conference. Our room, 1411, was a clean, comfortable room with a small sofa, small cocktail table, and large desk. Although it faced another building, off to the left was a limited view of the harbor. The room itself had excellent lighting, but the bathroom (toilet & tub area) was very dim. The sink and closet was in an open area off the foyer with no door for privacy. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in the wonderful Harbor East area, surrounded by good restaurants and within a short walking distance to Fell’s Point, which has even more restaurants. It is a very easy walking distance to the Inner Harbor and a manageable walking distance to the Convention Center for those with comfortable shoes and who love to walk. We did not take breakfast in the hotel & therefore cannot comment on it. I recommend this hotel for its proximity to excellent restaurants, the Inner Harbor & the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast,... very cold pool”
Reviews.Author: Lori085
Reviews.Content: We went up to Baltimore to meet up with family for the weekend. The hotel is in a perfect location to the inner harbor and little italy. You could walk everywhere. Very clean and great service. Breakfast is great, especially with little ones who want to try everything. Eggs to order, make your own waffles. Worth buying a breakfast option. We had small children with us who really want to stay at a hotel with a pool so we searched is this is the hotel we picked. It is a beautiful pool with a nice hot tub but unfortunately, I think they keep the pool temperature at 75 degrees, or less because it was freezing. It was a disappointment to my kids since they didn't want to get in because it was too cold. Great hotel, but if the pool is what you want, you may think twice, it was freezing.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Max777g
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night Feb 12, the hotel was clean and well staffed. Breakfast was great with a lot of people helping out. Nice bar in the lobby, great bartenders. We asked for a quite room and got it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmpjoy
Reviews.Content: We are gold members. The purpose of our trip was to attend an alumni event at JHU (homewood campus). We booked standard room with a weeekend rate of $129 which included free breakfast for everyone, $25 bonus bucks gc and two free movie tixs. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a corner suite. The room came with a fridge and microwave. Moreover, the room was set up with the pack play (no sheets). The front staff and bell man were super effeciant. The hotel is a great area - walking distance to all inner harbour attractions, little italy, port discovery, etc. The hotel is five minutes from the end of 83. Whole Foods is right next door. CVS is around the corner. The pool in the hotel was nice - there was also a hot tub. Only negative - there was no towels at pool. The lifeguard was proactive and called twice. I called the third time. The head of housekeeping delievered the towels approxmiately 30 minutes after first call. The free breakfast buffet was great - fruit, eggs made to order, waffle machine, yogurts, cereals, muffins, donuts, bacon, hash browns, oatmeal and assortment of drinks. I highly recomend for family with kids. Parking was $23 a day with in and out privileges. Lastly, in addition to its small fitness center, this hotel grants you access to another big gym down the street at no charge. I didn't use this, but the pictures looked impressive. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Low09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a family reunion around Christmas. The lobby was comfortable and we spent a lot of time there. The bar and restaurant were great, service was a bit slow inthe restaurant at breakfast but the staff was wonderful. Rooms were large ans very clean. Great location in downtown, were able to walk to all of the shopping and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mordana0
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent a day/night in Baltimore in October. This hotel was fine for us and the location was really good. We checked in Sat morning and then walked over to the Galleria at Inner Harbor. That was only about a 15 minute walk. Spent the day shopping and then walked back towards the hotel and stopped at the Irish Bar/Restaurant right around the corner from this hotel for happy hour. Had dinner at a "wine bar" right down the street from the hotel and then walked up to Fell's Point for a night of drinks. Although we didn't spend much time in the room, we had no issues and when we did have a room key issue the Front Desk employee didn't hesitiate to walk us to our room to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Hits & Misses”
Reviews.Author: YpsiKev
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for business. I received E-mail from the Courtyard "On-Line Concierge" asking if I had any requests. I did request an upper floor room, in-room fridge and microwave. I received none of these upon check in. The website said the pool was going to be closed for maintainance until Oct 19th, it opened the day I left (21st). My 5th floor room smelled slightly musty. The wireless internet service was slow, and I had to restart my computer several times to continue my work. On the plus side, the location was great, and Whole Foods and CVS in same building made for some convenient shopping for food and other items. The breakfast was decent, no complaints. This was my first Courtyard stay. For the price ($189/night) I have had better hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good price for great, safe location in baltimore”
Reviews.Author: trvlbugmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here twice and I am from Baltimore. I know the areas of the city and this is the one area I WOULD stay in. Most of the other hotels downtown and near the convention center are not in the best area. The hotel was clean, staff was competent and helpful, parking is on site in the adjacent garage (you have to pay but the parking is close). We also stayed here the night of our wedding in June of 2008 and again in December 2009 and both times very satisfied. Will recommend this hotel and only this hotel for family and friends visiting for price, safety and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: TTGG
Reviews.Content: Harbor East is the place to stay in Baltimore and this hotel is right in the middle of it. Room is nothing to write home about but it's clean and the bed is decent. Free passes to the nearby Maryland Athletic Club is a huge plus. Staff is very friendly - except for the breakfast team. Some of the city's best restaurants are steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value”
Reviews.Author: madubo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for overnight stays. Good location, clean and functional as expected in Courtyards.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back”
Reviews.Author: wco230
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent, polite, and resourceful. Our daughter loved the pool area and it is staffed with a lifeguard. Our bathroom light burned out and maintenance was there within 10 minutes after we called and fixed it. The room was clean and the king size bed felt wonderful after a long day at the harbor. We were close to walk to all events at the inner harbor. We also did some shopping in the city which made our location great. The front desk staff saved us $22 on parking by paying them at check out and informing us that our parking is good for all day so we basically got two days for the price of one. At breakfast there could've been some danish, etc. instead of just coffee, however they offer a great breakfast for $10 and it was worth it. The staff there did a great job for us. Overall my family of 4 was very pleased and when we return to the inner harbor we will use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Par With Other Marriott Properties!”
Reviews.Author: jrepok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Marriott Courtyard Inner Harbor for a one night stay. Check-in was fast, but when we got to our assigned room neither of our key cards would open the door, My wife went back to the desk to get the key checked out and returned with a front desk clerk who's attitude indicated that we did not know how to use the key card. Well, the desk clerk could not open the door either so she went back to the front desk to get us assigned another room. After waiting in the hall for several minutes the desk clerk returned with a new room assignment on a lower floor. When we arrived at the new room it was clean and nicely decorated, but was stuffy and warm. After trying to adjust the room thermostat, I discovered that no air was coming out of the vent. I then called the front desk to report the malfunction. A few minutes later a maintainance man came to the room and fixed the AC. We then decided to take a nap before going to a nearby restaurant. Unfortunately, our room faced an adjacent building that had huge air handling machinery on its roof. The machinery created a continuous, loud roaring sound, similar to a jet engine. Needless to say, the noise made sleeping a real challenge. The bathroom sink was only a single sink located outside of the bathroom (shower/tub/toilet area. With the coffee pot sitting next to the sink there was very little room to set your toiletries next to the sink. I've stayed in many Marriott Courtyard (and other) hotels over the years and found this stay to be one of the worst. If you get a room there, get one with an odd number; they don't face the loud air handling machinery.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, dissapointing staff”
Reviews.Author: Wailym
Reviews.Content: My family booked 2 rooms at this hotel the last weekend in February. The location was not as convenient as I expected. It is in the Harbor area, but still about 8 blocks from the Harbor. The hotel is much like all other Marriotts, pretty and clean. It has its own attached parking garage ($22 per night), bar and lounge in lobby, and good breakfast. The room was comfy and clean, no tub just stand up shower. We had a king size room with pull out sofa, and extra linens are provided for sofa. Now the bad news, check in and check out was horrible! Like all hotels we held the reservation with a credit card. However, I decided to pay cash upon arrival for everything, including incidentals. The staff at the counter did not know how to check us in! The second I said "cash", they needed to consult with eachother. Finally after about 15 mins we got checked in and our rooms were ready early as requested. Unfortunately, check out was the same nightmare. They didnt give me my complete refund back from incidentals, and a manager was not available to fix the problem. It was entered in computer incorrectly. I agreed to call the next day to resolve, but decided to let it slide because they paid for our parking instead. That following wednesday to my amazement Marriott had charged the FULL amount of our stay to my credit card! I was given the excuse that it happened because that is the credit card I used to hold the reservation! After several phone calls, the manager called my bank directly to have the funds released. Overall, not worth the headache and we will not stay there again. In my opinion, staff should be prepared for all situations. I have been a Marriott member since 2003.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price..would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: CATHYRT
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, could not get into front of hotel..blocked off. After circling block, could not fit in parking garage. (SUV's beware) Was not told also this parking would cost 22.00! Was instructed closest parking was almost a mile away..no shuttle service..cold.late..need I say more? They didn't "feel our pain" and made no attempt at trying to help us find a solution. I guess girls are just supposed to walk alone in the middle of the nite in a strange area..hmmm. asked for extra towels and pillows on reservations, however, recieved neither. No real views from anywhere in hotel. Furniture was old and scratched.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Clean Hotel with Value & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MichiganKidAlways
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Baltimore recently with a friend for a "girls weekend" get-away. We chose the Courtyard in Baltimore's Inner Harbor based on it's location, the great winter promotional price, reviews & the Marriott chain's consistent quality. This Courtyard hotel did not disappoint. It is conveniently located in Harbor East, a short walk or quick bus ride from the attractions of the inner harbor. The Charm City Circulator Orange Route bus (free) stops near the hotel making travel to/from the hotel & inner harbor easy. There are several restaurants, a Starbucks, & a movie theater in the immediate area. Little Italy & Fells Point are close by as well. The room & furnishings were extremely clean. The bedding & linens were not extremely plush or luxurious but were comfortable & clean. The size of the room was ample with enough room for the two beds & side chair. There would be enough room for a cot if needed. Our room overlooked a rooftop area of a lower level of the building & faced attached floors of an office building. The view might not have been spectacular but the room was very quiet. There was a small indoor pool with a hot tub on the 4th floor. The pool was staffed by a life-guard which must be the reason for the limited pool hours during the weekdays. The pool & pool area were clean & well maintained, but the pool water was too cold for us to enjoy the water. Overall the front desk customer service was helpful, quick & accommodating. The service at breakfast over the three night stay was somewhat inconsistent with service sometimes being slow & sometimes having to wait for eggs to be refilled on the buffet. We were not told until the third morning that we could order eggs or omelets made to order with the buffet. We had a room rate that included daily breakfast. One afternoon our key card did not work. The front desk gave us another one but did not ask for ID which is a safety concern. Also, we returned to our room one morning to find the housekeeper cleaning it & were able to go in & out with out being questioned. Hopefully, management will address these safety concerns with their staff. Overall, this hotel was a great value & met our expectations providing us with a comforable place to rest during the night & while we took breaks from our touring of the local attractions & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “best bang for your buck at the inner harbor!!”
Reviews.Author: MOISHE464
Reviews.Content: We caught a special thru the Marriot website....103 bucks a nite...including a full breakfast... omlettes made to order!! .....very tasty, too!.....Rooms are clean...and have 32" LCD TV's!!...Free Wifi is top rate!! ....elevators are quick, too!!...pool and whirlpool very nice...and they even had a lifeguard!!.....parking adds 22 dollars a nite...but at that room rate....it was still a bargain!! ..better to leave the car in the garage anyway...easier to walk than to drive... ...Great location...quick 10 minute walk to all the fun of the inner harbor..... The Whole Foods joint around the corner can save you big bucks on food and snacks! ...also a 24 hour CVS across the street!! ...If you can catch this rate on the next Marriot special....just book it!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near the Inner Harbor and Little Italy. There are many restaurants and bars within walking distance and it is adjacent to a Whole Foods store. The property is relatively modern and has a simple restaurant and bar (with a breakfast buffet for an additional fee) in the lobby as well as a limited snack shop typical of Courtyard properties. There is an indoor parking deck with a fee typical of downtown areas. Service at the front desk was cheerful and helpful. The room was medium sized and relatively modern. The bathroom was fine but the walk-in shower appeared somewhat older in appearance than the remainder of the room. The tv was modern and everything was in working order. There is a small balcony for fresh air and to take in the decent views of the harbor and downtown area. I have some complaints about the property. There were some cigarette butts on my balcony and I noticed the same dirty towel two consecutive days in the fitness center. Additionally the weights in the fitness center are worthless and should be replaced or simply discarded. Also, the bread in the breakfast buffet appeared old as if was kept out for consecutive days. Finally, Marriott reward members are given a coupon for up to 25% (depending on status level) off the price of a domestic beer or wine. I feel this is a real cheap "gift" as many hotels offer a free drink and some even have a complimentary wine happy hour. Overall not a bad place to stay for business or leisure but there are a lot of little things that would prevent me from considering this a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tohhall
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at this Courtyard and we've never been disappointed. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and pleasant. It's not luxurious but it is just fine for an overnight. The best part is the location, you can easily walk to the Inner Harbor or Fell's Point. There are lots of bars and restaurants nearby, a Starbucks, Whole Foods and movie theater too.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore stay in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Colette6
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly and very convenient to Inner Harbor attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating staff and spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mamakiwi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I make monthly trips to Johns Hopkins and after trying out a number of hotels in the Baltimore Inner Harbor area, we came to rest on this Marriott. It is now our standard hotel and we return every time - never to be disappointed. If our flight is early, they will have a room ready - no problems. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very, very comfortable. Nearby is some of Baltimore's very best dining - all within walking distance. There is also a Whole Foods, CVS and other shopping within the block. For tourists, this is a little off the main harbour drag - which makes it more quiet and refined. Yet, you can still walk or take a short cab ride down to the Hard Rock or the Aquarium - or all the great shopping downtown. Cabs are always available right outside the door!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jabooty
Reviews.Content: We go to Inner Harbor annually to spend a night and see a baseball game. We had stayed at the Marriott Harborview ($300 per night). When I went to check availability, I saw the Courtyard listed for $179 ($159 if we selected non refundable option). It made me think and check out location. It's the NEXT block. Granted, no as upscale, but we essentially check in, drop off bags and spend entire night in Inner Harbor and game and then simply sleep in room. Beds comfy, rooms clean, parking easy ($22), walk on coblestone sidewalks about a block and you are at doors of Marriott Harborview and just the short distance (10 min walk) to Inner Harbor, shorter if you walk faster! I think this place is such a value if you just intend on spending time away from hotel and simply sleep there. Does not have the grand marbel foyer and high rise, but the views are nice and it's quiet. I didn't hear anything while going to sleep (walls not paper thin...). Bathroom very clean. The price difference was spent on a REALLY nice dinner. My family laughed at how close we were to the other Marriott and how little we were paying. Besides, the Harborview now has a high rise condo unit going up next to it, which essentially eliminates the view from so many rooms. Courtyard is a win in our book if you are just sleeping there. Breakfast is too basic there, so we went to Falls Landing and then Lunch in Inner Harbor...niiiiice.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around!”
Reviews.Author: ajjarm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a trip to the Inner Harbor for the July 4th holiday weekend. We were pleased with the courtyard Mariott. It was a great location, quiet, safe, easy to park and enter/exit. Would stay there again for sure. Room was clean and I recommend the view from the 14th floor, harborview. Great shops nearby; close to fells point and little italy, too. Truly just what we hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jamie_UKStaffs
Reviews.Content: I don't think you'd do better for price and location. A good sized room with free wireless internet and nice staff. The location is near the Inner Harbor which is the main bit for shopping and tourist attractions. Do check out the Visionary Arts Museum which is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great, good location”
Reviews.Author: cruisermeg
Reviews.Content: We were originally going to stay here for 3 nights after a cruise. Arrived before noon and were given an accessible room with 2 beds as requested. All the accessible rooms connect and of course there were loud people in the room next to us..as well as all around us. As a Platinum Marriott member I got nothing...no upgrade, nada! And come to find out I should have gotten discount coupons for the restaurant. The rooms are pretty basic courtyard rooms...on the ugly side without much atmosphere. I have stayed in better Courtyards! Most of the stadd was nice if a little clueless. One supervisor was rather short with many guests....somewhat unprofessional in his demeanor. The hotel is located near a CVS, Whole Foods and lots of restaurants. The mexican place around the corner was very good but hte burger place next door was lousy. It's about a 20 minute walk over to the fun stuff in Inner Harbor. There is plenty to occupy people in the Harbor East area though. All in all, I will most likely not return. We moved to the Renaissance where I am at least in the middle of things, in a nice room with a view. I will review this property after checkout. Parking at the CY is 22 dollars a day-we did not have a car to park though luckily. I used a reward from Marriott to pay for the room and as I changed my reservation, the desk clerk had to call the hotline to find out how to handle my certificate. (She originally said that there was no one at Marriott Rewards on a Saturday to help which I knew was not the case.) The hotel isn't that bad and can be a good value. The location is fine, but we were disappointed in the overall experience and will not stay there again. The rooms need updating. They do have a flat screen TV and decent selection of channels though! Didn't eat breakfast in the hotel so I am not sure if it is any good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcpa
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location. I got a deal on the price through my work other wise I might not have stayed here as the price is usually over $200 a night. The staff was very nice and helpfull, the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. It is just a few blocks from Fell's Point and all the resaurants in Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Sakoro
Reviews.Content: We liked the location-- close to Fells Point and Inner Harbor. We used the pool and jacuzzi and found them to be clean and quiet. The only downside was when our neighbors arrived back at 2 in the morning, we could hear their entire conversation through the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town”
Reviews.Author: Gustoguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Marriott points. A really good deal for the points. Rooms are typical Marriott - very clean, spacious and functional. Had a 'million dollar view' of the harbor from the next to top floor. Spectacular at night. Requested 'something special' from the concierge for my wife and daughter and was pleasantly surprised with the chocolate covered strawberries and asti spumante for a reasonable price. Was able to walk to the inner harbor, restaurants in Little Italy and cheap breakfast coffee houses in Fells Point. Don't miss the shopping in Fells Point - cool stores, lots of bars, and many coffee houses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: CueGF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went out for the evening in Baltimore, as we have done a few times before, and stayed at this Courtyard for the first time. The hotel was conveniently located close to Fells Point which we love to visit when we are in the area. Checking in went very smoothly, and the gentleman at the front desk was extremely courteous and friendly. He gave us a choice of available room floors and even provided us with directions to Pazo’s restaurant, which was nearby, along with a list of other restaurants and venues in the area. The room had a king size bed, which was very comfortable, and had a small balcony. It was a very pleasant stay and fairly priced (comparably lower than some of the surrounding hotels). The only drawback was the price of parking which was about $22 for one evening.

Reviews.Title: “off the main Inner Harbor path but convenient”
Reviews.Author: subdave
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my three night stay at this out of the way hotel close to Little Italy, Fell's Point, and a 12 minute brisk walk over the bridges on a 3-4-5 diagonal Pythagoreum Theorum hike to the Convention Center and Camden Yards. Staff was very friendly and helpful pointing out local amenities such as Whole Foods and local restaurants. Breakfast buffet for under 10 bucks was great and included seldom-seen corned beef hash and creamed chipped beef. Needless to say, I didn't require lunch after making three trips to the chow line, much to the dismay of the hands-on manager who observed the food cost going through the roof and his bonus going out the door! Bedding is great as was noticed in the Courtyard print ads. All in all, a wonderful experience, especially the hikes to and from the Inner Harbor on the crisp, cool days of fall. Take a shuttle from the airport and enjoy the fresh air, and leave the cars in the rental lots. I enjoy the ten miles (minimum)of daily walking every time I visit the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Inner Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: Mary112
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inner Harbor Courtyard and have to say it was the best experience I have ever had! The service was outstanding, the room was extremely clean, the breakfast was delicious, and the location can't be beat. The staff at the Courtyard went above and beyond to exceed my expectations. I will only stay at the Courtyard when I travel to Baltimore. Also, one of the other comments mentioned the parking rate being $44. This is incorrect. The parking was only $22 overnight which is comparable to the other hotels in the area. Thank you for a wonderful stay! I will recommend this hotel to anyone visting the Baltimore area. This was by far the BEST hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Parking was ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: Trinity524
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small, but clean. If you stay one night though, you pay 44 dollars for parking....quite the rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant one night stay in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: ldb61
Reviews.Content: convenient location for our 1 night in Baltimore. In room wireless worked well and the lobby had additional computer and printer for guest use. Staff was very friendly and directed us to seafood restaurant which had a take section for our casual family dinner. (forgot the name, but its a popular place for crab cakes) Whole foods market very convenient next door. Room rate seemed high ($249) but that's the best we could do in the area for a family of four. Easy walk to all the sights, only took public transit to amtrak station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kysgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel August 7 - 10 and it was terrific! The location was great: CVS across the street, Whole Foods and a wine store right next door. We were there for a wedding at the Pier 5 hotel and it was a quick 10 minute walk away (even in heels). The inner harbor itself was close by as well as several restaurants. Clean room and free internet! Only two things that I didn't like: The nightly charge of $22 for parking and there wasn't much counter space around the sink. Also, for those that have never stayed in a downtown area: We still heard the sounds of the city even up on the 9th floor. Overall, it was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: MOJOBO48
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel, situated on the inner harbor of Baltimore, largely based on price and location. Little did I know that courtesy and service made me especially happy I picked this hotel. I was visiting Washington with two teenage boys, my son and a friend, and decided to take them to see Baltimore and catch a ball game. My husband decided to cut short a conference on the west coast and join us. Trouble was, he caught a red-eye flight and arrived at 7:30 in the morning, pretty tired. I called the hotel, explained the circumstances and asked if we could have access to our room at 8:30 am instead of at 3 p.m. The staff could not have been more understanding and accommodating, and gave us the room at the time we requested -- and didn't charge us a dime extra. The room was large and the beds comfortable, so my husband got the rest he needed before the game. Only negative thing I can think of regarding the hotel was the pool -- it's kind of small, but a bigger problem, it only opened at 5 pm during the week and closed at 10. The hours were inconvenient, to say the least. But that's a minor point.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: rgb411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while on business. Would stay here again for sure. Staff are friendly and very helpful. The restaurant does a fair to average breakfast. Wireless internet access is free. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OK night at the Courtyard Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: KrMcD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a short break on a Saturday night and booked a room at the Courtyard Marriott. We live in Baltimore so we are familiar with most of the hotels, their rates and amenities. We chose the Courtyard because of its location in Inner Harbor East, where we could walk to Fells Point, the new movie theatre, and to many restaurants and bars. We booked an upgraded room with a whirlpool tub. The room was fine but small and the "upgraded" bathroom was clean but pretty bare-bones (no mini-fridge, one comfortable chair very close to the bed, which made it difficult to get in or out of bed on that side, harsh lighting in the bathroom). The rate, with tax and parking (not included) was more than $300.00, which is on the high side for a weekend night in an Inner Harbor hotel. There is a small breakfast room off the hotel lobby. It did not appear to serve any meal other than breakfast. In other hotels with similar "breakfast rooms," the breakfast was included in the room rate, It is not included here, unless one books a rate with breakfast. The Courtyard should post a notice to that effect at the entrance to the breakfast room because patrons at two other tables were (like us) surprised to be given a bill for breakfast, because they thought breakfast was included. At $10.00 each for a breakfast buffet that was OK but no better than the free breakfasts in similar hotels, we all concluded we would not have ordered had we been aware it was not included. It's a nice hotel with a good location. However, for a much lower rate, and a much more luxurious room (with a great breakfast included), I would recommend Henderson's Wharf, in Fells Point. There are also two new Hilton properties right around the corner from the Courtyard. We will give them a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: 3KidsM
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the Little Italy section of Baltimore, in close walking distance to the Inner Harbor. I went with my two young daughters and had the Aquarium Package. For the price this was a great value. The girls loved the indoor pool and free breakfast. Also, getting two tickets to the Aquarium and free parking were big savings. We easily walked to the Aquarium and the Maryland Science Center. Girls loved the Science Center (ages 9 and 7) - go early and beat the crowds. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mar32
Reviews.Content: Note: I rate hotels solely based on the quality and irrespective of the price. If ratings were based on both the price and the experience, it would be impossible to discern any useful information, therefore with my ratings, one can determine exactly how good the hotels are and then compare prices separately. Generally, the more expensive hotels are better, but not always. I would rate the Courtyard Marriott as a fairly nice hotel, although the room was somewhat small. The room was new and clean. There is wireless Internet access, and there were supposed to be fridges/microwaves available for free, but they had run out the night I requested one. My only complaint was that there was a speaker on the wall that emitted a continuous very soft staticky noise which was tremendously annoying when I was trying to fall asleep. I only noticed it after turning off everything else in the room, so if you have extremely good hearing it may be bothersome to you and I ended up turning on the fan to help drown out the noise. I am not sure what the purpose of the device is, maybe it acts as a fire alarm. The hotel is expensive, which I think is more due to the location than the amenities, and there is an additional maybe $15 of taxes on top per day, due to Baltimore state tax. There is a Whole Foods store inside of the same building which you can go to for groceries and they also sell a hot breakfast which is cheaper than the one in the Courtyard restaurant. Ask at the front desk how to get there. There are taxis waiting outside continuously for your convenience. There do not seem to be any places to go to within walking distance of the hotel, however. Overall, I was pleased with my stay, but not the price.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Choice”
Reviews.Author: kasey363
Reviews.Content: As a fairly frequent visitor to Baltimore (known as Fenway South) during Red Sox vs Orioles games; this location and Courtyard was a great find! I had stayed in inner harbor (YIKES$$$$$) times before and had decided to stay cheaper close to the airport for the weekend - but found this location days before the weekend and was psyched I did! First - I'm a rewards memeber so I stay at lots of Marriotts (at all levels) and are seldom disappointed - but being a city person I know the "location" can be the "make or break"in a city - especially in Baltimore which definaitely has a "gritty" side/feel to it (not necessairly a bad thing - but a consideration for safety). This location in Harbor East was excellent. We (two females) felt perfectly safe walking in area both to and from Inner Harbor, and Fells Point in both day and night. We walked and took the water taxi ($8.00 for the day - great value and just two blocks to this hotel from the landing). I really liked that on this side of the harbor you had both the conveience of walking to all inner harbor has, and in the other direction (about four blocks) you were in Fells Point with all it's shops, restaurants, local Foodie Market (like Lexington Market in Philly and so many other cities) and bars (local and touristy) galore. We ate a "Angie's" in the open market (local counter service and you can't beat a great down home lunch for most under $5.00!) Note: there are also two water taxi stops in the Fells Point Area (from inner harbor) so you have that option too and then you can easlity walk back to hotel. The hotel itself is new, clean, spacious. Restaurant on site for breakfast buffett (not complimentary) - we didn't partake - not with great local breakfast joints so close - but buffet looked pretty good. Service was pleasant (and it was a very busy weekend) and responsive. All the usual amenities of a Coutyard and even more so - several computer to use free of charge, had a small bar and nice sit down areas with flat acreen TV's, couches, tables etc. One late night after game we got take-out from a inner harbor restaurant - took the water taxi back and ate in this "living room" area (not to stink up the room) - it was great. Others were having wine and beers another section watching TV. Nice touch. The best thing though for this "inner harbor" convenience and to be so close to Fells Point and Little Italy area (which is just another few blocks north of the hotel (save that for next time!) was that the cost was extremely reasonable ($179.00 AAA rate for Sat). All other hotels in the inner harbor (and the Marriott Inner Harbor which is a block next to this Courtyard) were in the $300-$500 range. To stay at the airport (Springhill Suites I had booked was $139.00) and to have to take the light rail to and from this inner harbor area for the difference of approx $40.00 was a no-brainer! You were right in local inner harbor area - great deal! My choice for all future trips to Baltimore - can't beat the quality and certainly the location. Also for those of you whom drive - parking garage is right next to entrance - reasonable for a city. And also - Whole Foods in same block of buiidling - great take out eats, good stuff for picnic etc and a new Starbucks right around the corner opening very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: JDK5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent, but staff was not very friendly. I dont know, it seems that front desk clerks are miserable these days. Maybe it depends on what city you go to. The room was kinda small, but clean. Pool was clean, which was a plus for my kids. It was great to have a Whole Foods in the same building.

Reviews.Title: “Really surprised at the quaity”
Reviews.Author: IrvingPlace
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked by a company that is located in the same complex as the hotel. I expected a business type hotel/room but was very surprised at how large and comfortable the hotel, especially because it is a Courtyard facility which to me is more a motel hotel ( located on the highway). Service was very friendly but looked as though they used young, inexperienced people, still in the learning stage, but nothing that made the stay uncomfortable. Breakfast was good, well priced. Location is excellent - in the midst of the Inner Harbor development, close to the Baltimore Oriole's Camden Yards, restaurants, cafes, bars, etc. Definitely an upscale area and appeared safe to walk around at night. Only spent one night, so do not have a lot of info on the area spots.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations. Bonus: Whole Foods in building.”
Reviews.Author: alp65
Reviews.Content: Located in the renovated wharf/harbor area, the Courtyard Baltimore Downtown is new, clean and a great value. Don't expect 5 star service or amenities - it's only a Courtyard, after all. Housekeeping service was just fine. The hotel is a little bit off the beaten path of the Harborplace, but it is within walking distance of both Harborfront and Fells Point. Oriole Park is a bit further (about 1.5 miles away). In/out parking is a great option, if you have a car. An added bonus - there's a Whole Foods right in the building so you can stock up on your own snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: setonmj
Reviews.Content: Me and the Mrs. thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard Baltimore. We were in town for the Antiques Roadshow that was in town for the day. The hotel is in a rapidly expanding area just slighty off the Inner Harbor in Little Italy section of Baltimore. There is alot of contstruction of luxury condos so the area is in a state of flux. One of the big plusses is that the hotels share the same building as a Whole Foods Market where if you dont want to go out to eat and just want to chill in the room you can pick something up and take to your room. The hotel staff was friendly and answered any questions we had with courtesy and a smile (this should be a given for hotels but unfortunately it is not so). The room was very clean and the bed was just right. Parking is $13.25 per day (if you dont use your car) but if you plan to drive around during your stay you can have your parking ticked validated by the hotel staff and you can have unlimited acess in or out for $19 per day. There is an abundance of restaurants in the area for all types of food. We enjoyed Mo's Crab and Pasta for lunch and Della Notte for Sunday brunch (it is pricey but the food is exellent and you get live jazz while you eat). The hotel is a 10 min walk to the Harbor and shopping so that isnt overwhelming especially on a nice breezy summer day. I definately recommend this location for a stay in Charm City.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice One-Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: mderaba
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and comfortable hotel near the Inner Harbor. I was on a business trip and found it to be nearly perfect for my stay. Parking is in an adjacent garage with direct access. The bed mattress and linens are heavenly! Nice work desk with computer ports, etc. I did not take advantage of the other amenties at the hotel, but it is near Little Italy and the Harbor restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: FrankCH
Reviews.Content: Our room was a nice size, clean, and the beds and pillows were comfortable. Now for the other side of the coin... The sink in our room did not drain. We called the front desk and arranged for Maintenance to come up after my wife and I left for dinner. We returned around midnight - the sink drain still did not work. As we were getting ready for bed, we discovered the TV remote did not work. The next morning we discovered the drain in the bathtub was also plugged... Seems a good housekeeping staff with the right attention to detail would have noticed these problems. All-in-all the room was not worth the $255 plus tax we paid. We will not be returning....

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Baltimore Downtown / Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 1000 Aliceanna St, Baltimore, MD 21202
